business.headline: 7 major income tax changes in 2025 that will impact your money2025 has brought a wave of changes to India's income tax rules, from bigger exemptions to extended filing deadlines. Here's a simple breakdown of the seven key updates that could directly affect your finances.

Cognizant to roll out wage hikes for 80% of eligible employees. Details hereIT giant Cognizant is set to give salary hikes to 80% of eligible employees from November 1, with top performers in India receiving high single-digit increases.

JSW Cement shares fall after listing at 4% premium: Should you hold or sell?JSW Cement's share price listed at 4% above its issue price of Rs 147. On the BSE, the stock opened at Rs 153, up 4.1%, while on the NSE it debuted at Rs 153.50, a gain of 4.4%.

Man invested Rs 18,000/month for 4 years, earned less than FDs. CA explains whyThe investor believed he was on the right track. His funds showed a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 11%. But when he calculated his portfolio XIRR—the actual return on his money—it was just 6%. That's less than the 7% a fixed deposit would have paid over the same period.
Pakistan's credit rating gets a lift from Moody's. Here's whyS&P Global Ratings raised Pakistan's rating to B- from CCC+ on July 24, while Fitch Ratings did the same in April.

RBI's new rule: Cheques to clear in just hours starting this dateUnder the new rule, cheques will be scanned, presented, and cleared continuously during business hours, reducing the clearing cycle from the current T+1 days to just a few hours.

ICICI Bank cuts minimum balance after backlash. Check new rules and penaltiesThe bank's decision comes after strong public criticism, particularly over the earlier increase in urban and metro monthly average balance levels.
JSW Cement shares list at 4% premium on stock market debut On the BSE, the shares opened at Rs 153, up 4.1%, while on the NSE they began trading at Rs 153.50, a gain of 4.4%.

Muthoot Finance shares jump 10% to hit record high after Q1 results. Should you buy?The gold loan financing company has seen its stock lifted by strong quarterly performance, rising investor confidence, and positive brokerage recommendations. Shares of the company were trading 10.43% higher at Rs 2,772.55 on the BSE at 10:04 am.
Bitcoin surges past $124,000 to hit all-time high. What's fueling the rally?Bitcoin hit an all-time high of $124,000. Here's why Bitcoin surged past $124K and will it keep climbing?

Sensex, Nifty open higher as IT stocks rally; Infosys, Wipro among top gainersThe S&P BSE Sensex opened more than 100 points higher and was trading 51.75 points up at 80,591.66 around 9:25 am. The NSE Nifty50 rose 13.80 points to 24,633.15.

Gujarat's textile industry threatened by 50% US tariffs demands 10% export incentiveIndia's total textile exports to the US are valued at USD 10–12 billion annually, with Gujarat accounting for more than 15 per cent of that trade.

Mumbai regulatory body acts against Palais Royale developer over Rs 100 crore duesMahaRERA's adjudicating officer has now issued recovery warrants under Section 40(1) of the RERA Act, enabling the District Collector to recover the amount as arrears of land revenue.

US tariff impact will be temporary, private sector should step up: Chief economistChief Economic Advisor V Anantha Nageswaran attributed the growth slowdown in FY25, which saw a deceleration to 6.5 per cent from FY24's 9.2 per cent, to tight credit conditions and liquidity issues.

ICICI Bank lowers minimum balance for savings accounts after outrageThe new minimum average balance thresholds are as follows: Rs 15,000 for customers in metro and urban areas, Rs 7,500 for semi-urban customers, and Rs 2,500 for those in rural locations.

5 credit score myths you should stop believingYour credit score can open doors to better loans and credit cards, or shut them. Yet, many people still rely on half-truths and hearsay. Let's separate fact from fiction.

Sebi eases rules for foreign investors: Here's all you need to knowSebi plans to introduce simpler rules to make it easier for foreign investors to enter India's markets. The move aims to cut compliance burdens and attract more long-term overseas capital.

Indians sent abroad enough money in a decade to build 62 IITs, says RBI dataIn 2023–24 alone, students remitted about Rs 29,000 crore abroad for their studies, almost the same as the previous year. A decade ago, this figure was just Rs 2,429 crore.

Unified Pension Scheme offers security, but why aren't employees joining?With assured monthly income and inflation protection, UPS should have been an instant hit. Instead, uptake has been lukewarm. Here's why.

Sensex ends 304 points higher, Nifty above 24,600; pharma stocks lead gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex rose 304.32 points to 80,539.91, while the NSE Nifty50 added 131.95 points, finishing at 24,619.35. Broader market indices also ended the session in the green, as investor sentiment was lifted by favourable inflation data from both India and the US.
Inflation falls to an 8-year low, but are households feeling any relief?Inflation has fallen to an eight-year low, but are households really feeling the pinch ease in everyday expenses?
ChrysCapital takes over Theobroma bakery chain for Rs 2000 croresChrysCapital acquires majority control of Theobroma in a Rs 2,000 crore deal, with the founders retaining only a 10% minority stake.

Nithin Kamath explains how Sebi's quiet tech reform is empowering investorsBrokerage firms have to connect with several entities, like multiple stock exchanges, depositories, banks, and others. This meant hundreds of APIs and file formats had to be handled separately, creating hidden challenges behind the scenes.
SIPs, small-caps, and the Gen Z rush for high returnsGen Z investors are chasing big gains in mid- and small-cap funds, but soaring valuations and volatile markets mean the ride could get bumpy.

Tax perks, hidden costs, rental yield: What first-time homebuyers should knowStepping into the property market for the first time? Before you sign any papers, make sure you're financially prepared to handle not just the purchase price but the many hidden costs that follow. Here's a beginner's financial checklist to make your property investment a smart one.

NSDL rally hits roadblock after Q1 results, shares tumble nearly 5%. What next?After a strong IPO and initial rally, investors are reassessing NSDL's near-term growth prospects in light of mixed operational performance.
Explained: Why Paytm shares surged over 5% todayPaytm's share price rallied nearly 6% after RBI approval, lifting investor optimism amid steady business performance.

Markets open higher on easing inflation; mixed global cues keep investors cautiousThe S&P BSE Sensex initially rose over 300 points but pared some gains to trade 155.05 points higher at 80,390.64 around 9:25 am. The NSE Nifty50 was up 71.60 points to 24,559.

Sunjay Kapur's Rs 30,000-crore fortune without a will: Who's likely to gain most?In the weeks since Sunjay Kapur's death, the silence around succession has been broken by a chorus of competing voices: his mother Rani Kapur, his widow Priya Sachdev Kapur, his sisters, and even mentions of his former wives.
Nikkei's share average hits record-high, tops 43,000 for first timeThe Nikkei .N225 on Wednesday rose as much as 1.2 per cent in the first few minutes of trade to reach a record 43,241.27.

Lapses, irregularities, round tipping: Yes Bank's Rs 500 crore loan sale under scannerThe audit found indications that YES Bank may have indirectly financed the purchase of its own stressed asset. The transaction dates back to March 31, 2017, when the bank sold HDIL's non-performing loan, valued at over Rs 523 crore including interest, to Suraksha ARC for Rs 518 crore.

Ambanis retain crown as India's most valuable family business in 2025Mukesh Ambani leads Reliance Industries Limited, which has roots in the energy sector but also has major operations in retail and digital services. Founded in 1957 by Dhirubhai Ambani, the company is now managed by the second generation and continues to be a key force in India's economy.

Sebi rejects Anil Ambani's plea in Yes Bank case, ED probe continues: ReportThe case relates to investments worth Rs 21,500 crore made by Reliance Mutual Fund, then owned by Anil Ambani, in Yes Bank's additional tier-1 (AT-1) bonds between 2016 and 2019.

Retail inflation eases to 8-year low of 1.55% in JulyRetail inflation declined to an 8-year low in July 2025 as food prices plunged sharply. Both rural and urban areas experienced deflation in food prices, with rural food inflation at -1.74% and urban at -1.90%.
Sensex ends 368 points lower, Nifty below 24,500; Maruti down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 368.49 points to end at 80,235.59, while the NSE Nifty50 declined by 97.65 points to close at 24,487.40.
RBI's job gets tougher, thanks to 50% US tariffsRBI kept the repo rate steady at 5.5% and warned that US tariffs and global supply issues could quickly change the outlook.

SIPs for the win: How Trump tariffs shook D-Street but boosted mutual fundsMutual funds are seeing record inflows even as markets struggle. Are SIP investors spotting an opportunity the rest are missing, or is it just faith in long-term discipline?
India bans land imports of more Bangladesh jute productsEarlier on June 27, India prohibited imports of a number of jute products and woven fabrics from Bangladesh through all land routes.

5 SIP myths that hurt investors more than markets, explains stock market expertMany investors blame market volatility for poor returns, but often, it's the myths they believe about SIPs that do more harm. Here's what an expert reveals.

How to repay a Rs 1 crore home loan in under 10 years and save Rs 52 lakhThe joy of getting the keys to your home is unmatched, but the reality of a 20-year (or longer) home loan often brings with it a heavy financial commitment.

entertainment.headline: War 2 review: Hrithik Roshan, Jr NTR take a world tour, story stays homeRelease Date:Thu Aug 14, 2025War 2 movie review: The Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR-starrer is more like a travel brochure tirelessly shot for three hours. The only real mission is to save the story, but how can you save something that doesn't exist?

Zoe Kravitz shares hilarious snake mishap that destroyed Taylor Swift's bathroomActor Zoe Kravitz shares how a pet snake, a wildfire evacuation, and Taylor Swift's Beverly Hills mansion led to an unforgettable, and destructive celebrity sleepover.

Sidharth and Janhvi seek blessings at Tirupati ahead of Param Sundari releaseActors Sidharth Malhotra and Janhvi Kapoor visited the Tirumala temple in Tirupati on Wednesday. Their visit came ahead of the release of their film 'Param Sundari' on August 29. Malhotra opened up about his experience in an Instagram video.

Actor Sadaa Sayed moved to tears over top court's stray dog order: I feel ashamedActor Sadaa Sayed broke down in tears over the Supreme Court's order to remove all stray dogs from Delhi. Her emotional response highlights the controversy and public concern surrounding the ruling.

KBC 17: Delhi's Kashish Singhal fails to answer Rs 1 crore question on ancient RomeIn the latest episode of 'Kaun Banega Crorepati' 17, contestant Kashish Singhal succeeded in winning Rs 50 lakh, which will assist her in repaying the loan of Rs 15 lakh that her father took during the family's time of crisis.

Andhera review: Priya Bapat, Karanvir Malhotra shine in this dim seriesRelease Date:Thu Aug 14, 2025Prime Video's latest series, 'Andhera, starring Priya Bapat, Karanvir Malhotra, and Prajakta Koli, premiered on August 14. The serious blends supernatural horror with sci-fi ambition but falters due to an underdeveloped core idea and uneven storytelling.

Sharmila Tagore says Supreme Court stray dog ruling shuts door on the voicelessVeteran Bollywood actor Sharmila Tagore is the latest public figure to speak out against the Supreme Court's ruling to relocate stray dogs from the Delhi-NCR region.

Video: Pankaj Tripathi arrives for Mirzapur The Film's muhurat pujaThe muhurat puja of 'Mirzapur The Film' was held on Wednesday at the Excel office in Mumbai. It was attended by Pankaj Tripathi, Ravi Kishan, Rasika Dugal, Ali Fazal, Shweta Tripathi, Shirya Pilgaonkar, Harshita Gaur, Jitendra Kumar and Divyenndu.

Coolie review: Rajinikanth's film has too many ideas, but too little impactRelease Date:Thu Aug 14, 2025Coolie movie review: Director Lokesh Kanagaraj's 'Coolie', starring Rajinikanth, Shruti Haasan and Sathyaraj, is a template revenge thriller that takes more detours than it should. Keeping Rajinikanth's charm aside, the film hardly offers anything new or substantial.

Coolie: Aamir Khan's fanboy moment with Rajinikanth hits the spotAamir Khan's cameo in Rajinikanth's 'Coolie' has caught the attention of all. The actor impressed fans with his swag in the climax of the movie.

War 2 X review: Hrithik and Jr NTR's action thrills, but story sparks debateWar 2, starring Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR, sparked mixed reactions. Praised for its action and visuals, but criticised for plot and VFX. Fans are divided.

Shilpa Shirodkar's car hit by bus, slams transport firm for shirking responsibilityActor Shilpa Shirodkar's car was struck by a Cityflo bus in Mumbai on Wednesday. The bus company denied liability despite police assistance in filing a complaint.

Taylor Swift unveils Life of a Showgirl album, cover, and featuresPop sensation Taylor Swift shares details for her 12th studio album 'The Life of a Showgirl'. The former Eras tourmates will team up on the LP's title track.

Coolie X review: Rajinikanth's energy and Nagarjuna's charm win fans overRajinikanth's 'Coolie' released in theatres today, and fans are in the mood to celebrate. Directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, the theatres have turned into a carnival with fans rejoicing and dancing.

Steve trailer: Cillian Murphy as headmaster fights his inner demons at reform schoolNetflix has released the official trailer for Steve, a drama starring Cillian Murphy as a headteacher fighting to save his reform school. The film explores deep mental health issues amid institutional challenges in the 1990s England.

Antony Starr shares farewell note ahead of final season of The BoysActor Antony Starr bid farewell to his role as Homelander in 'The Boys' in a heartfelt Instagram. He said the role helped him grow personally and creatively. The fifth and final season of 'The Boys' will be released in 2026.

Vivek Agnihotri's The Bengal Files trailer to be attached with War 2 and CoolieThe trailer for director Vivek Agnihotri's upcoming film 'The Bengal Files: Right to Life' will be attached to 'War 2' and 'Coolie'. Here's what we know.

Hrithik, Jr NTR urge fans to let War 2 be a secret to everyone: Spoilers are no funHrithik Roshan and Jr NTR appealed to fans to keep 'War 2' spoilers under wraps ahead of the film's release. Their request aims to preserve the film's thrilling experience for all viewers.

Atif Aslam mourns father Muhammad Aslam's death: Final goodbye to my Iron manIn an emotional post, Pakistani singer Atif Aslam shared the news of his father Muhammad Aslam's death on Tuesday. His father, aged 77, died of health complications. Atif Aslam has sung several hit songs for both Pakistani and Indian films.

general news.headline: 12 feared dead after massive cloudburst in Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar Live UpdatesA massive cloudburst struck Chositi in Jammu and Kashmir near the Machail Mata Shrine on Thursday, prompting fears of significant casualties and immediate deployment of rescue teams by the administration.

Exclusive: Dharmasthala whistleblower claims burial orders came from templeIn an exclusive India Today interview, the Dharmasthala whistle-blower alleged decades-long undocumented burials in forest areas. He claimed temple authorities ordered the burials, many showing assault marks, while locals remained silent.

Akhilesh Yadav expels Samajwadi Party MLA hours after her praise for Yogi AdityanathSamajwadi Party Member of the Legislative Assembly Pooja Pal praised Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath for delivering justice and acting against criminals. Hours later, the Samajwadi Party expelled her for anti-party activities, citing serious indiscipline.
Jinnah's escape, Gandhi's struggle, Nehru's tryst: The last 24 hours of British RajOn August 14, 1947, tension, hope, and tragedy swirled, as the countdown to the end of the British Raj began.

Pakistan to create Army Rocket Force after Op Sindoor setbackWeeks after biting the dust against India during Operation Sindoor, Pakistan has announced the formation of an Army Rocket Force, which is reportedly modelled after the Chinese People's Liberation Army Rocket Force. The new force will oversee missile combat in conventional conflicts.

Ashwin exposes CSK, claims team paid Dewald Brevis under the table in IPL 2025Legendary spinner Ravichandran Ashwin has exposed the Indian Premier League's under the table deals. Ashwin has claimed that CSK paid a much higher price than the stipulated Rs 2.2 crore.

Chilling video of robbery at ex-judge's home, one loots, other ready to attackA gang of masked and armed burglars broke into retired Justice Ramesh Garg's Indore home, looting cash and valuables worth several lakh rupees with professional precision while the family was sleeping.

Buried 80 bodies myself: Dharmasthala whistleblower's explosive 'revelations'The whistleblower in the Dharmasthala mass burial case revealed how the bodies, allegedly of sexual assault victims, were buried in forest areas without documentation or official oversight.

How Pune's indestructible JM Road shames contractors, babus, netas alikeCan a road in India remain pothole-free for 50 years? A 2.5-km stretch in Pune, known as Jangli Maharaj Road, shines as an example of civic engineering amid the pan-India pothole plague. Built in 1976, the road came with a 10-year warranty and hasn't needed major repairs in all these years.

Man dead, 2 injured as tree crashes on bike in Delhi's Kalkaji amid heavy rainA large tree fell on a bike in Delhi's Kalkaji amid heavy rain, killing one and injuring two, also damaging a nearby vehicle. Severe waterlogging hit key Delhi roads ahead of Independence Day.

When pet dog lover Gandhiji approved the killing of 60 straysMahatma Gandhi, who was committed to ahimsa, approved the killing of 60 stray dogs when human lives were at risk. He saw it as a "duty in distress", not indiscriminate violence. His stance reflected the delicate balance between compassion and societal responsibility of that time. In 2015, his views were quoted in the Supreme Court.

Why are people picking old iPhones in India over new Androids?According to IDC, the iPhone 16 as well as the iPhone 15 were the most shipped smartphone models in India in the first half of 2025. And then there are the iPhone 14 and iPhone 13, which continue to sell. So, why are old iPhones still selling despite new and faster Android smartphones are available in the market? We explain.

How developing brain in teens plays key role in consent for sexThe government has argued against reducing the age of consent for sex from 18 to 16. While there are legal arguments, neuroscience shows how a developing brain is wired for risk-taking and impulsive behaviour. How does this understanding of the brain tally with the age of consent debate?

Rules made but not implemented: In stray dogs case, top court raps civic bodiesA three-judge bench of the Supreme Court reserved its order on petitions challenging its much-criticised August 11 verdict directing the rounding up of all animals in Delhi-NCR.

I am a doctor and this is the single worst thing you can do to your liverOur liver doesn't get the respect it deserves. As unhealthy lifestyles rise, here's the single most harmful habit that can damage the second-largest organ in the body.

Indian aquanauts make record 5,000-metre dive, plant tricolour in AtlanticUsing the submersible's manipulator, the aquanauts marked their historic presence by planting both nations' flags at the crushing depths.

Will this drug end baldness forever?PP405 is a new topical drug that targets the root cause of hair loss and reactivates dormant follicles. Its success could change hair loss treatment in India but awaits further clinical trials.

Fencing sisters Jyotika and Rishika turn grit and guts into global recognitionFencers Jyotika Dutta and Rishika Khajuria have turned hard work and persistence into results. Their Under Armour deal is a milestone, showing that Indian fencing has talent, promise, and a brighter future.

Salt and sugar for babies? Grandma's all for both, science isn'tEven though doctors strongly advise no sugar and no salt for infants, many elderly caregivers find it hard to accept. But real care isn't about sticking to old habits, it's about understanding what's truly best for the baby.

Actor Darshan's bail cancelled, Supreme Court warns against 5-star treatmentThe Supreme Court cancelled Kannada actor Darshan's bail in Renukaswamy murder case, calling the Karnataka High Court order "perverse" and "arbitrary." It warned against any special treatment in jail. Authorities were ordered to take him into custody expeditiously.

Bites children: Video shows UP man dragging dog around by tying it to scooterIn Jhansi, a scooty rider dragged a dog tied to a rope, claiming it was biting children, sparking outrage online. The incident coincides with the Supreme Court's directive to sterilise and relocate stray dogs to prevent rabies.

A demand for national meat sale calendar amid non-veg row in MaharashtraThe Poultry Federation of India has urged the Union Minister to introduce a meat sales calendar to avoid disputes and financial losses from meat bans during religious festivals and holidays.

sports.headline: Shoaib Akhtar rips into Pakistan batters, calls for mega changes in culturePakistan bowling legend Shoaib Akhtar has slammed the team's batting performance after their crushing ODI series loss to West Indies. Akhtar has warned that the star batters won't find flat pitches everywhere.

Joe Root responds to David Warner's 'surfboard' remark ahead of Ashes 2025-26Star England batter Joe Root has responded to David Warner's remarks about his poor performances in Australia. Warner had said that Josh Hazlewood is going to give Root a tough time in Australia.

Sanju Samson's trade to Chennai Super Kings is not going to work: R AshwinChennai Super Kings (CSK) spinner Ravichandran Ashwin has said that the trade deal between CSK and Rajasthan Royals (RR) may not come to fruition due to several factors.

However, despite his current slump, he's still Pakistan's best option in the middle order, and replacing him could cause more problems for the team.

Chennai Grand Masters: Karthikeyan beats Vidit, Keymer closes in on titleGrandmaster M Karthikeyan kept his hopes alive in the Chennai Grand Masters with a hard-fought win over compatriot Vidit Gujrathi in Round 7, while Germany's Vincent Keymer tightened his grip on the title race. With only two rounds remaining, Keymer leads by 1.5 points and could clinch the crown in the next round.

Arjun Tendulkar gets engaged to hotelier Ravi Ghai's granddaughter Saaniya ChandokLegendary Indian batter Sachin Tendulkar's son, Arjun Tendulkar, has been engaged to Saaniya Chandok, the granddaughter of prominent Mumbai businessman Ravi Ghai.

ISL saga: AIFF calls for meeting between legal counsels of federation and clubsThe All India Football Federation (AIFF) has asked the legal representatives of the federation and Indian Super League (ISL) clubs to hold discussions over the uncertainty surrounding the upcoming season of India's top-tier football league.

Top End T20 series 2025: Squads, schedule and all you need to knowThe Top End T20 Series 2025, running from August 14 to 24 in Darwin, features 11 teams, including international sides like Pakistan Shaheens, Bangladesh A, and Nepal. The tournament will showcase exciting T20 action, ending with the final on August 24.

Jannik Sinner a competition animal: How coach's advice scripted Italian star's riseDarren Cahill has played a key role in Jannik Sinner's rise to the top, focusing on consistent daily work. Since joining forces with Cahill in 2022, Sinner has won four Grand Slam titles, including Wimbledon, and now aims to defend his title at the US Open.

PSG vs Tottenham Live Streaming, UEFA Super Cup final 2025: All you need to knowEuropa League champions Tottenham Hotspur will be aiming to secure their second trophy in just three months when they face Champions League winners Paris Saint-Germain in the UEFA Super Cup on Wednesday.

Watch: Chef Rishabh Pant bakes Pizza with broken foot, unveils hilarious avatarIndia wicketkeeper batter Rishabh Pant recently tried his hand at baking as he attempted to make a pizza with a broken foot with his own hilarious accent.

CPL 2025: Squads, schedule and all you need to knowThe Caribbean Premier League (CPL) 2025 runs from August 14 to September 21, featuring six top Caribbean teams competing in exciting T20 action. The season kicks off with St Kitts & Nevis Patriots vs. Antigua & Barbuda Falcons, with all knockout matches held in Guyana.

England have a changed approach, they're trying to win and not entertain: LyonAustralia off-spinner Nathan Lyon has been left impressed with England's Bazball approach ahead of the Ashes in Australia. He said that they're more focused on winning matches instead of just entertaining.

National Sports Bill to be implemented within six months: Mansukh MandaviyaThe National Sports Governance Bill will be implemented fully within six months, introducing key reforms in Indian sports. The law formalises government powers in international participation and ensures athlete representation, aiming to boost India's global sports standing.

Radha, Yastika shine as India A Women clinch 1st One-Dayer vs AustraliaRadha Yadav picked up three wickets while Yastika Bhatia scored 59 as India A Women took a 1-0 lead in the series with a three-wicket win over Australia A Women.

Marcus Rashford hits out at Manchester United's endless managerial shuffleMarcus Rashford says Manchester United's constant managerial changes and lack of a long-term plan have left the club "in no man's land," stressing that true success needs stability, principles, and a clear footballing identity.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
